qas.question: In what year was the Non-Aligned Movment formed?
Who was named leader of the NAM in 1964?
What global conflict was the NAM made to counter?

context: After years of foreign policy coordination and developing ties, Nasser, President Sukarno of Indonesia, President Tito of Yugoslavia, and Prime Minister Nehru of India founded the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) in <a0_0>1961<a0_0/>. Its declared purpose was to solidify international non-alignment and promote world peace amid the <a2_0>Cold War<a2_0/>, end colonization, and increase economic cooperation among developing countries. In 1964, <a1_0>Nasser<a1_0/> was made president of the NAM and held the second conference of the organization in Cairo.
